answers.answer: Which T-3 and T-4 levels were done at the same blood draw as your TSH 0.01TSH 0.01 suggest hyperthyroidism.Uptake suggest hyperthyroidism caused by  Graves' disease.FT-4 levels are low for hyper Graves'The Tg, Tg Abs and Thyroperoxidase Antibody are seen in  Grave's disease, Hashimoto's thyroiditis, idiopathic thyroid atrophy, De Quervain's thyroiditis - transiently, and  certain percentage in males and  females without thyroid disease. Thyroglobulin may occur in organ-specific autoimmune diseases, including pernicious anemia, Addison's disease, type I diabetes mellitus , polyglandular endocrine failure syndromes etc. Sjögren syndrome, lupus, rheumatoid arthritis, and pernicious anemia are sometimes positive. As well as in the normal population without thyroid disorders.There are more specific antibody test for Graves' and Hashi.I believe normally beta blockers are given to help the hyper symptoms of heart issues.  I was given beta blockers when my BP sky rocketed after RAI treatment.You might go for second opinion.
